p.s: PEAR2\Exception is the standard exception class for PEAR2.
p.d:
In addition to supporting the default signature of the built-in Exception class, PEAR2\Exception also supports passing a cause of an exception, which can be another exception object or a PEAR2_MultiErrors object. The error messages of the causes are used when constructing the error message displayed when converting PEAR2\Exception to a string.
PEAR2\Exception should always be extended by your own custom exception class for the package.

p.s: PEAR2_MultiErrors provides a simple and effective mechanism for aggregating many errors and organizing them by severity.
Class to perform HTTP requests. Uses an adapter based system for performing those requests
p.d:
Please see the examples dir for basic usage
Adapters are available for based on the following code and are used in this order:
* PEAR2\HTTP\Request\Adapter\Http (uses the Pecl Http class) * PEAR2\HTTP\Request\Adapter\Curl (based on the curl extension, not complete) * PEAR2\HTTP\Request\Adapter\Phpstream (based on the http php stream code) * PEAR2\HTTP\Request\Adapter\Phpsocket (based on php sockets, built from PEAR1 HTTP_Request)
Additional adapters:
* PEAR2\HTTP\Request\Adapter\Filesystem (useful for mock Internet interaction)
